name: Florence Pugh
description: Acclaimed English actress known for her versatile roles in indie films and major blockbusters.

content.title: Biography
content.body: Florence Pugh, born on January 3, 1996, in Oxford, England, is a renowned English actress. She began her acting journey with the 2014 mystery drama film *The Falling*. Her standout performances and unique approach have made her one of the most sought-after actresses in the industry.

content.title: Career
content.body: Florence Pugh gained recognition for her compelling performance in the 2016 independent film *Lady Macbeth*, earning her critical acclaim. She later starred in *Fighting with My Family* (2019), a biographical sports comedy-drama film, and *Midsommar* (2019), a horror film directed by Ari Aster. Her role as Amy March in Greta Gerwig's *Little Women* (2019) earned her an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actress.

content.title: Notable Collaborations
content.body: Pugh's notable collaborations include working with acclaimed directors Greta Gerwig and Ari Aster. She also acted alongside actors like Saoirse Ronan and Timoth√©e Chalamet in *Little Women*.

content.title: Legacy
content.body: Florence Pugh is celebrated for her ability to deliver powerful performances across various genres. She has been recognized with numerous awards and nominations, solidifying her impact on modern cinema as a versatile and committed actress.
